http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: In Grades K-6, students receive a foundation in Arkansas History. Arkansas History Grades 7-8 is an in-depth and rigorous study of civics/government, economics, geography, and history of the state. The format of this course encourages teachers to incorporate the social, cultural, and geographic information particular to their locality when developing district curriculum.
Geography
Students will analyze geographic attributes of Arkansas.
Compare and contrast the six geographic regions of Arkansas using geographic representations and available geospatial technologies
Analyze the availability of resources and their effects on the development of each geographic region of the state

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., diamonds, bauxite, oil, timber, agricultural, wild game

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Evaluate the reciprocal impact of humans and water systems in Arkansas over time

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., trade, transportation, recreation, flood control

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Analyze effects of weather, climate, and natural phenomena on the environment of specific regions over time

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., New Madrid earthquakes, Flood of 1927, Drought of 1930, tornado alley

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will analyze ways the geography of Arkansas influenced the development of the state.
Analyze the impact of geography on settlement and movement patterns over time using geographic representations and a variety of primary and secondary sources

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., Louisiana Purchase survey, westward movement, voluntary and involuntary migration and immigration

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Analyze relationships between the geography of Arkansas and economic development over time
Examine ways the geography of Arkansas affected cultural characteristics of places and regions
Economics
Students will analyze economic influences on Arkansas.
Examine the impact of natural resources on the economy of Arkansas

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., agriculture, timber, hydroelectricity, mining, tourism

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Analyze the economic impact of transportation systems in Arkansas
Analyze how various regions of Arkansas developed and changed economically
Examine contributions of Arkansas entrepreneurs on economic development in Arkansas
Students will analyze the economic impact of Arkansas nationally and globally.
Examine contributions of Arkansas entrepreneurs in the national and global economies
Analyze the impact of Arkansas businesses and industries on local, national, and global economies

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., agriculture, tourism, timber, technology, medical and scientific research, finance

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Investigate Arkansas's global economic contributions through educational and humanitarian efforts

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., Fulbright Institute, Clinton School of Public Service, Heifer International, corporate and private foundations

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Civics and Government
Students will analyze government and politics in Arkansas.
Examine the functions and powers of the three branches of government in Arkansas
Examine features of government in Arkansas with reference to the Arkansas Constitution
Analyze the political process in Arkansas

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., voting, party politics, role of media, changes in the election process, term limits

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Examine rights and responsibilities of citizenship in Arkansas
Students will analyze the influence of government and politics on social issues.
Analyze the role of government and public policy on social concerns in Arkansas over time

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., unemployment, education, poverty, immigration, culture

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Examine the effects of social issues on the evolution of political parties in Arkansas
History
Students will examine the impact of historical events and people on the development of Arkansas.
Evaluate ways that historical events in Arkansas were shaped by circumstances in time and place
Summarize the process by which Arkansas achieved statehood
Analyze the historical significance of selected Civil War battles, events, and people on various regions of Arkansas
Examine effects of Reconstruction in Arkansas using multiple, relevant historical sources

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., Brooks-Baxter War, Constitution 1874, Freedmen's Bureau, sharecropping, segregation laws

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Discuss social, economic, and political reforms of the Progressive Era in Arkansas from multiple perspectives using a variety of sources
Investigate social, economic, and political effects of World War I and World War II on various segments of the population in Arkansas
Examine social, economic, and political effects of the Great Depression and the New Deal on various regions and segments of the population in Arkansas
Analyze social, economic, and political effects of the Civil Rights Movement on various regions in Arkansas from multiple perspectives
Examine social and cultural transformations in Arkansas

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., counterculture, drug culture, breakdown of the family, feminist movement, music, art, clothing

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Research contributions made by Arkansans in the fields of art, medicine, politics, science, and technology in the 20th and 21st centuries
Construct historical arguments about the contributions made by various political and military leaders in Arkansas
